jobDescription:
Looking to break into the booming cannabis industry in Oregon? Do you have experience trimming and caring for cannabis? Weed love to hear from you!

GreenForce is an Oregon based, full-service staffing and temporary employment agency focused on labor solutions for the cannabis industry. We specialize in providing skilled harvesting, cultivation lifecycle, and trimming temporary labor services for licensed Oregon producers. Our founders are business leaders who have come together to utilize their deep and varied experience in the cannabis, beverage, healthcare, staffing, and financial services industries to provide much needed labor solutions to the burgeoning legal cannabis industry.

 We are looking for team players that are passionate about cannabis. Any of these qualities sound like you?

 - Live in Oregon
- Must have begun OLCC Marijuana Worker Permit process*
- Must be organized and maintain a clean work space
- Ability to follow standard operation procedures
- Ability to sit for long periods of time
- Reliable transportation
- Flexible Schedule

*OLCC permit is required before any placement can occur. It can take 3-5 weeks, so it is strongly recommended that you start the process early. If you do not have one, please apply HERE: http://www.oregon.gov/olcc/marijuana/Pages/mjworkerpermit.aspx

 Applications MUST be submitted via our portal listed here: http://greenforce.crelate.com/portal/job/zhzbctalmyu-444599

Check out our website: https://www.greenforcestaffing.com

Follow us on social media: https://www.facebook.com/GreenforceOregon/

 GreenForce Staffing is an equal opportunity employer. GreenForce Staffing will not discriminate and will take measures to ensure against discrimination in employment, recruitment, advertisements for employment, compensation, termination, upgrading, promotions, and other conditions of employment against any employee or job applicant on the bases of race, creed, color, sexual orientation, national origin, or sex.

jobDescription:

Patient Care Advocate (Budtender)

Justice Grown (JG) holds the medical marijuana dispensary permit in Luzerne County, Pennsylvania. We are seeking a highly motivated individual with a strong work ethic to join our customer service team as a Patient Care Advocate (PCA). Every PCA must ensure only the highest standard of care for JG patients and demonstrate knowledge and understanding of cannabis use in the treatment of a variety of symptoms. PCAs must have a working knowledge of the Pennsylvania Medical Marijuana Program as well as expertise about the medical attributes of a variety of strains. Previous customer service experience, knowledge of basic computer skills, point of sale software and cash management experience strongly preferred. **CANNABIS KNOWLEDGE REQUIRED AND INDUSTRY EXPERIENCE PREFERRED**

This position requires constant critical thinking, problem solving, listening and verbal skills. PCAs must draw on their knowledge of products and medicinal properties of cannabis to accommodate the lifestyle and treatment goals of each and every patient. PCAs will help develop individualized treatment plans while developing and building relationships with patients. PCAs must listen intently, provide thoughtful feedback and effectively articulate recommendations to patients. PCAs are essential in creating a caring and supportive environment at JG and will take an active role in patient care. PCAs will engage in a variety of dispensary operations including: patient registration and check in, visitor check in, security compliance, patient consultation, product and strain education, use of industry specific software, cash and inventory maintenances, and marketing including social media postings.

Responsibilities include: Providing customer service in a professional and welcoming manner to a wide spectrum of patientsRegistering new patients with the PA Medical Marijuana ProgramWelcoming and checking in registered patientsAnswering phones and providing information about the ProgramEfficiently processing patient transactions and executing cash handling skills such as counting down cash drawers at the beginning and end of every shiftProperly educating customers on all cannabis and infused productsMaintaining knowledge of all company products, compliance regulations and store proceduresAssist in maintaining a safe, clean and professional work environmentAssist with marketing campaigns including social media postings and participation in local events

Skills and Abilities: Properly follow cash handling proceduresAccurately maintain inventory counts within their designated consulting roomMaintain an understanding of and follow HIPPA regulationsMaintain an understanding of and apply PA State program regulationsFollow security protocolUtilize highest standards of customer service in person and on telephoneDetail orientedExcellent computer skillsTeam playerAble to adapt to new technology and procedure changesSecurity, sales, or healthcare experience is preferable

Physical RequirementsAble to stand for long periods of timeAble to bend, reach, and squat periodicallyMust be able to work weekendsCandidate must be over the age of 21Candidate must reside in PA, preferably with an active Medical Marijuana ID Card.

Current or intended participation in the PA medical marijuana program strongly preferred. A passion and personal relationship with the use of cannabis to treat medical conditions is key for this position. Please explain in your cover letter why you would like a career in medical cannabis. Position Description:

To facilitate daily garden operations within the companyâ€™s production facilities, including the consistent monitoring of cultivation room environment variables, plant health diagnostics, watering, fertilizing, pest mitigation, exhaust and lighting maintenance, and other relative duties pertaining to the maintenance and upkeep of a recreational cannabis cultivation facility. Cultivation Technicians are also expected to follow and implement a conscientious healthcare management model, striving to operate under the highest standards of customer care and professionalism.

Skills and Qualifications:

An ideal candidate will be a self-motivated, critical thinker. With a focus on efficiency and always considering customer needs. In addition, to being solutions oriented, results driven, the ideal candidate will excel in completing tasks according to a strict schedule of tasks. Furthermore, Dalwhinnie Farms expects Cultivation Technicians to possess a high level of plant science but not limited to solely cannabis. Cultivation Technicians must posses the knowledge and ability to diagnose abiotic stresses, general environmental conditions and identifies pests throughout the cultivation cycle. Additionally, Cultivation Technicians are responsible for lifting up to 50 lbs. on a regular basis, as well as relying on the full extension of the legs and arms to reach items and fulfill many garden duties.

Responsibilities and Expectations:

  • Cultivation Technicians are responsible for maintaining clean and orderly workplaces.
  • Positive attitude and a passion for high-quality plant production.
  • Follows production plan in aiding the Cultivation Manager or Director of Crop Production, cutting selected plants for clones, growing plants from seed, transplanting, moving plants between cultivation rooms, preparing propagation tools, and any other tasks as directed.
  • Sweeping, mopping and washing cultivation equipment.
  • Achieves production objectives by conducting garden procedures in accordance to production operations management schedules, programs and implementations.
  • Identifies plant health issues including but not limited to abiotic stresses (nutrition, lighting, watering abnormalities), insects, molds, and diseases.
  • Assist Research and Development department as directed.
  • Applies water to plants occasionally by hand, depending on the cultivation methodology. Additionally, Cultivation Technicians must attend to irrigation drippers to ensure they are functioning properly and applying water evenly to each plant.
  • Assist in implementation of cultivation SOPs.
  • Operate heavy and light horticultural equipment and machinery.
  • Ensures all plant waste created is weighed, recorded and destroyed in compliance to all state and local municipality regulations.
  • Maintains pesticide application logs that document the time and date of application.
  • Abides by Dalwhinnie Farms security and safety protocols. In addition, Cultivation Technicians will protect themselves and other employees by providing a safe and clean workplace environment.
  • Assists Facility Manager and completes facility maintenance tasks as needed and troubleshoots operational and technological issues as they arise.
  • Ensures the stability and reputation of the production facility by complying with all state and local laws.
  • Assists State and Local government regulators, auditors, and law enforcement agents with inspection visits and information requests.
  • Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending ongoing educational workshops, reviewing professional publications, establishing professional networks, participating in professional groups and attending industry events.
  • Utilizes required production tracking software programs and responsible for the accuracy of inventory, compliance reports, and all other aspects of data collection.

Other Employment Requirements:

  • No felony convictions
  • Must have valid Colorado drivers license
  • B.S. in plant science, floriculture, horticulture, agronomy a plus but not required
  • 1-2 years in greenhouse, floriculture or cannabis production
  • Individuals applying must be a minimum of twenty-one (21) years old
  • Applicants must be a Colorado resident
  • An extensive background check that may include personal financial history
  • Willing to travel
  • Any moral character requirements as specified by Dalwhinnie Farms and that are in accordance with the Colorado medical and recreational cannabis programs
  • Working conditions can include completing physical tasks in hot and humid environments, indoors and out. Some situations demand that work be completed on weekends and holidays depending on legal requirements circumstance and severity of outcome

Dalwhinnie Farms Cultivation Manager Job Description

Position Description:

To supervise and manage the daily cultivation operations of the companyâ€™s cultivation facilities to include selecting plant nutrients, implementing dynamic IPM, maintaining production documents, scheduling all cultivation staff as directed by the Director of Crop Production. Dalwhinnie Farms follows and implements a conscientious healthcare management model, striving to operate under the highest standards of patient care and professionalism.

Skills and Qualifications:

The Cultivation Manager needs to be a discipline driven individual, a manager of people and plants, detail orientated regarding notes and numbers, and always considering our end user; the medical patient customer. In addition, the ideal Cultivation Manager will be solutions-oriented, results driven, and a strategic planner that excels in verbal communication as well as management techniques. Furthermore, Dalwhinnie Farms expects the Cultivation Manager to possess a high level of cannabis industry and market knowledge, the ability to closely track budget expenses, understand effective product pricing, and maintain high-quality vendor relationships where needed. Cultivation Managers are responsible for lifting up to 50 lbs. on a regular basis, as well as relying on the full extension of the legs and arms to reach items and fulfill many garden duties.

Responsibilities and Expectations:

  • Satisfies and completes cultivation operational requirements by scheduling and assigning employees, and then following up on work results. Furthermore, the Cultivation Manager will ensure staff is always properly tasked in the cultivation facility.
  • Follows and completes production plan by attending weekly meetings with the Director of Crop Production. In addition, the Cultivation Manager will direct cultivation staff in accomplishing set production results, establishing priorities, monitoring task progress, revising employee schedules as needed, resolving problems, and reporting the results to the Director of Crop Production.
  • Maintains cultivation staff by selecting, orienting, and training employees on Dalwhinnie Farms policies procedures, and roles. Specifically, this includes conducting the interview process in tandem with the Director of Crop Production and delivering cultivation staff quarterly reviews.
  • Upholds cultivation staff job results by educating, coaching, counseling, and disciplining employees.
  • Achieves cultivation production objectives by preparing a weekly and/or monthly cultivation outlook and then scheduling employees accordingly.
  • Must be proficient in the METRC system.
  • Ensures the maximum availability of on-hand inventory by effectively supervising daily cultivation tasks to include pot washing, sweeping and mopping among other necessary operational cultivation requirements.
  • Maintains inventories of supplies to include but not limited to any articles of employee personal protection equipment, all plant/soil media, as well as nutrient stock supply.
  • Notifies Director of Crop Production of additional scheduling needs in advance of employee vacations, illnesses, and all other areas relating to cultivation staffing.
  • Reports to Director of Crop Production if potential bottlenecks or hazards in cultivation production and/or forecasting begin to arise.
  • Secures and accounts for flower product by implementing and abiding by Dalwhinnie Farms security systems and safety measures. In addition, the Cultivation Manager will protect employees by providing a safe and clean workplace environment.
  • Ensures the stability and reputation of the cultivation facility by complying with all legal requirements at the local city and state levels.
  • Assists state and local government regulators, auditors, and law enforcement agents with inspection visits and information requests.
  • Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending ongoing educational workshops, reviewing professional publications, establishing professional networks, and participating in industry groups and events.
  • Upholds cultivation operations by taking the lead, coordinating processes, and enforcing Dalwhinnie Farms program, procedural, and personnel policies and expectations. The Cultivation Manager ensures production crew complete daily tasks in a way that is clean and organized.

Other Employment Requirements:

  • No felony convictions.
  • Must have valid Colorado drivers license
  • B.S. in plant science, floriculture, horticulture, agronomy a plus but not required
  • 5 years in greenhouse, floriculture or cannabis production
  • Individuals applying must be a minimum of twenty-one (21) years old

  • Working conditions can include completing physical tasks in hot and humid environments, indoors and out. In some instances lifting up to 50lbs repeatedly

Research Associate - Denver, CO

Rx Green Technologies is the leader in natural based nutrients for commercial Cannabis cultivators. We seek a Research Associate in Denver, CO, to contribute to our Research and Development team related to the development of new nutritional and yield enhancement products in Cannabis. This role will be responsible for execution of trial protocols, analysis of plant samples, and management of trial data. The position requires effective and frequent communication with Research and Development and Operations teams to ensure execution of high-quality research. The candidate must have strong organizational skills in order to effectively execute trials, data collection, and sample processing. Attention to detail is a must. The Research Associate may also assist colleagues in daily operational tasks.

This position will largely focus on the day-to-day activities associated with Research and Development trials. The Research Associate will organize and perform measurements on trial plants per research protocols as well as conduct laboratory analysis of plant samples using various analytical instruments. This position will contribute to organization and management of trial data. The candidate will work collaboratively with Operations team on maintenance of trial plants and application of experimental technologies. This position will be responsible for collaboration with Research and Development team on reporting of trial results. Adherence to workplace safety and quality standards is a must.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelors degree in crop science, soil science, horticulture, plant physiology, plant pathology or related field AND two years experience conducting research in controlled environments or greenhouse setting required

  • Prior experience in operating laboratory instruments (ICP, HPLC, GC-MS, etcâ€¦) is preferred
  • Excellent communication skills, attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines, and strong organizational skills are required
  • Other qualifications include solid computer skills and ability to thrive in a team environment
  • This position requires the ability to stand for long periods of time

Knowledge, Abilities and Skill

The work environment involves everyday discomforts typical of offices, with occasional exposure to outside elements. Physical and Mental Requirements

Parkside Utility Construction, a telecommunications utility contractor, is currently seeking  Field Inspectors to work in their Harleysville, PA and Fredericksburg, PA locations.  The inspectors must have 2 years’ experience working as a field inspector in the utility construction field, have a good understanding of communication with construction plant builds and working in a team environment.

These high CBD strains have become our foundation for creating safe medication for patients in need.

About the Position The City of Las Vegas is seeking a Business License Section Manager to oversee our Business License Compliance and Enforcement section. This position is responsible for investigations into confidential business license activities, including revenue audits, commercial property compliance, and field enforcement.Successful candidate would supervise professional, technical, and support staff; work closely with law enforcement jurisdictions within Clark County to enforce business licensing codes as well as state and local regulatory agencies on mutual issues, which may require inter-jurisdictional enforcement. Appear in court as required; attend City Council and other meetings to present analysis, reports and information. Candidate must have the ability to work a flexible work schedule.   The ideal candidate is expected to have knowledge and experience in business licensing, municipal codes and regulations, human resources management, and supervisory/leadership skills. To supervise, assign and review the work of staff responsible for general business licensing including compliance and enforcement, and the audit of business license fees and taxes; to manage administrative activities for the division; to provide responsible staff assistance to the division manager and higher level management; to coordinate projects within the division as assigned by the division manager; and to perform a variety of tasks relative to the assigned area of responsibility. Supervision Received And Exercised Receives direction from the Business Licensing Manager and higher level management. Exercises direct supervision over professional, technical and clerical staff.  May exercise technical supervision over division supervisors. EXAMPLE OF DUTIES Essential Functions: Plan, prioritize, assign, supervise and review the work of staff responsible for general business licensing, compliance, enforcement, and the audit of business license fees and taxes; ensure the quality of business license applications processed by staff; ensure the delivery of quality customer service. Conduct preliminary background investigations for business license applications and review related sensitive and confidential reports. Reviews investigation reports and determines code applicability; verifies violations and makes determination on case resolution or prosecution to civil penalties or referral to City Attorney. Attend City Council meetings and briefings; present staff reports and information; assist in handling business license appeals before the City Manager and City Council.  Represent the City in civil penalty hearings and as the division representative in judicial proceedings against businesses. Respond to and resolve complex, difficult and sensitive citizen and business owner issues, inquiries and complaints, including explaining fees, taxes, procedures and regulations. Participate in developing the division budget and drafting, updating, recommending and implementing division goals, objectives, policies and procedures; develop and coordinate strategies for the review, design, development and implementation of business license improvement projects. Establish schedules and methods for improving services; coordinate work with that of other staff, divisions, departments and agencies; review needs with appropriate management staff; allocate resources accordingly. Participate in the selection of staff; motivate assigned staff; coordinate and provide staff training; plan, direct, coordinate and review the work plan for assigned staff; assign work activities, projects and programs; establish work priorities and schedules; review and evaluate work products, methods and procedures; prepare and conduct formal performance evaluations; work with employees to develop short and long term goals, monitor accomplishments, establish performance requirements and personal development targets and provide coaching for performance improvement and development. Research and propose potential code revisions to address the city's needs and priorities, resolve issues or facilitate desired outcomes; confer with legal staff and other city employees regarding business license code revisions; draft ordinances to implement code changes. Review and interpret state law as to its applicability to business license codes, policies, procedures and the business license process.  Work with state and local regulatory agencies on mutual issues which may require inter-jurisdictional enforcement. Coordinate division representation at small business development seminars several times per year; inform visitors of general business licensing regulations, processes and procedures.  Coordinate training for businesses on code changes, inspections and the interpretation of state laws in relation to regulated substances such as alcohol, medical marijuana and other privilege licenses. Represent the division on large commercial development coordination teams, along with representatives of other city departments, developers and business owners. Participate in the administration of the division budget; monitor expenses; estimate time, materials and equipment required to accomplish goals and objectives and requisition materials as needed. Prepare analytical and statistical reports on operations and activities. Assist in developing a culture that values people and their differences and is free from inequities and barriers to people reaching their full potential. Assist in promoting sustainable, environmentally sensitive development and operations in the community and the division. Assist in establishing the strategic direction for the division in alignment with City Council and city of Las Vegas strategic priorities; assist in communicating to assigned employees their roles in performance measurement and achieving strategic priorities; and work with staff to report measures to department management. Marginal Functions: Attend and participate in professional group meetings; stay abreast of current trends and innovations in the field of business licensing. Perform related duties and responsibilities as required. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS Experience: Four years of progressively responsible business license or business management experience.  Two years of supervisory or lead experience. Training: Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with a major in business administration, public administration or a field related to the essential functions.  May substitute a combination of equivalent education and related experience.  The city  assesses 1.5 years of fulltime experience as equivalent to one year of education. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES Knowledge of: Operations, services and activities of the Business Licensing division.Business licensing rules, regulations and procedures.Pertinent federal, state and local laws, codes and regulations.Principles of supervision, training and performance evaluation.Principles and practices of municipal budget preparation and administration.Computer system application re-design processes.Principles of business writing and report preparation.Complex record keeping procedures and techniques.Current office procedures, methods, computer equipment and common office software packages. Ability to: Demonstrate problem solving, critical thinking and planning skills.Interpret, apply, explain and enforce federal, state and local laws, ordinances, policies, procedures and regulations.Accurately calculate license fees and taxes based on codes and regulations.Act calmly, rationally, decisively and tactfully in difficult situations.Analyze complex problems, identify alternative solutions, project consequences of proposed actions, and recommend best options.Manage multiple assignments and projects.Set and adjust priorities in a rapidly changing environment.Plan, organize and prioritize assignments.Use initiative and independent judgment within established guidelines.Meet critical deadlines.Communicate with individuals from a variety of social, cultural, economic and educational backgrounds while demonstrating respect and sensitivity for perceived differences.Produce written documents with clearly organized thoughts using proper sentence construction, punctuation, spelling and grammar.Explain complex technical systems in clear and simple terms understandable to non-technical staff.Demonstrate strong oral communication and presentation skills.Demonstrate respect and sensitivity for cultural differences.Prepare clear and concise reports.Communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.Establish and maintain effective working relationships with those contacted in the course of work.Competencies: In addition to Core Workforce Competencies: Supervisor Competencies Professionalism – Models core values by being honest, respectful and positive; continuously demonstrates the core values of the city; supervisory actions are collaborative whenever possible and intended to grow the city's capacity at an individual, unit, division and/or department level. Managing Performance – Takes responsibility for own and assigned employees' performance, by setting clear goals and expectations, tracking progress against the goals, ensuring regular feedback, and addressing performance problems and issues promptly. Decisiveness – Willingness to make difficult decisions in a timely manner. Developing and Empowering Others – Willingness to delegate responsibility; coaching assigned employee to develop their capabilities. Facilitating Partnerships – Builds community and partnerships both inside and outside the organization. Forward Thinking – Anticipating the consequences of situations and decisions; taking appropriate action to be prepared for possible changes. Job Summary:

The Extraction Technician will assist with the production of high quality cannabis extracts along with cleaning and maintaining laboratory and equipment, recording and entering data, and associated tasks. The Extraction Technician will be responsible for the consistent, sanitary and safe production of cannabis extracts utilizing company policies to successfully uphold quality and consistency of all products produced. The individual has the responsibility of extracting, refining and purifying cannabinoids and terpenes from cannabis plant material into a concentrated form using solvent and solventless processes.

________________________________________________________________________

Essential/Primary Responsibilities:

  • Regular communication with the CCC Management Team is to be maintained to ensure all operational needs are met and any procedural problems are addressed and resolved proactively.
  • Responsible for extracting, refining, and processing cannabinoids and terpenes from cannabis plant material into a concentrated form using solvents and solventless processes.

Experience / Knowledge Required:

  • Commercial cannabis laboratory experience is preferred.
  • Extensive hands on experience with purification, separation, and crystallization of various compounds, preferably including cannabinoids.
  • One to two years of experience with hemp and MMJ oil processing, winterization, distillate and separation.
  • Colorado MED Key or Support Badge, METRC certified.
  • ServSafe certified.

________________________________________________________________________

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Observe and listen to equipment to detect possible malfunctions, such as leaks or plugging, and report malfunctions or undesirable tastes to supervisors
  • Set up, operate, and tend equipment and various instruments according to SOPs
  • Turn valve controls to start equipment and to adjust operation to maintain product quality
  • Select and measure or weigh ingredients, using English or metric measures and balance scales
  • Press switches and turn knobs to start, adjust, and regulate equipment pressures to produce the ideal CO2 extraction environment within the closed loop system
  • Record production and test data for each product batch, such as the ingredients used, temperature, test results, and time cycle, and pressures during the extraction process
  • Examine product samples during production to evaluate quality, color, and texture and document the results
  • Perform all necessary equipment maintenance and safety checks in accordance with manufacturer specifications
  • Ensure that the production space is tidy, clean, and sanitary throughout daily operations
  • Able to explain the process from originating material through the extraction and purge, in a simplified and clear manner
  • Complete all necessary inventory tracking paperwork for both prep and extraction
  • Physically operate the system and perform the extraction
  • Follow all safety protocols put into place for machine operation every time
  • Tends solvent extraction equipment and non-solvents refinement equipment that extracts and refines oil from a variety of cannabis plant material.
  • Perform other official duties as assigned.

_______________________________________________________________________

Required experience:

  • CO2 Extraction: 1 year

Job Summary

Arizona Natural Selections is a premier medical marijuana company, with retail locations in Scottsdale and Peoria. Our purpose is to provide our patients with the best craft cannabis and the most outstanding customer service in all of Arizona.

Our Inventory Control Manager will manage and oversee our trim, packaging, and inventory departments at our cultivation facility. Ideal candidates should possess the following skills: excellent communication, strong at people development, have problem solving abilities, organized, action oriented, and have experience with managing people. The Inventory Control Manager will report to the Cultivation Facilities Director and partner with them on the initiatives of their department.

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Build and lead a diverse team of employees to strive for efficiency, while maintaining a positive work environment they want to be a part of each and every day.
  • Manage all staff in inventory control, trimming, and packaging, including hiring, scheduling, employee development, etc.
  • Develop, manage, and implement consistency in inventory and packaging control, procedures and efficiencies
  • Identify, analyze and assess business opportunities, processes, and workflows of the inventory control, trimming and packaging departments
  • Monitors and maintains inventory levels for Packaging department
  • Responsible for data entry and maintaining records and evaluations of performance metrics to ensure they are correct, compliant, and meets goals
  • Overseeing the planning and scheduling of distribution of product from cultivation to the retail stores
  • Responsible for inventory, supplies, and reconciliation of actual stock count to computer-generated reports. (Records all within inventory software system and Company files)
  • Operates within AZDHS guidelines
  • Oversee inventory compliance requirements directed by the Cultivation Managers
  • Performs miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned by the Cultivation Director

Qualifications and Skills

  • Leadership and management experience and ability to train staff to operate within facility protocol required
  • MS Office
  • Experience with standard inventory and electronic handling of data
  • Cannabis would also be an excellent advantage
  • Experience with MJ Freeway preferred
  • Bilingual in Spanish preferred
  • Driver's License required
  • Bachelor's Degree preferred

Medical, Dental and Vison

Are you ready to be part of a growing and innovative organization? The Hartford Dispensary is looking for a motivated, hardworking, Human Resources Assistant. The Hartford Dispensary provides an excellent opportunity for those seeking to be part of a team-oriented and compassionate organization. The HR Assistant is an important role for the Hartford Dispensary as it is an essential position in supporting our committed and passionate employees with the tools and information needed to perform their job to the best of their ability. If you have excellent time management and customer service skills and want to be part of our expanding organization, then you are strongly encouraged to apply.

Mission Statement

The Hartford Dispensary is committed to the delivery of quality behavioral health services to all in need in the state of Connecticut. The Hartford Dispensary, founded in 1871, is a leading behavioral healthcare provider dedicated to treating behavior health needs. Accredited by CARF for its high standards of care, the Hartford Dispensary seeks out passionate and talented individuals to join its staff. Regardless of the position held, each employee plays an important role in caring for clients and providing support in their recovery. Today, the Hartford Dispensary is one of the largest providers of methadone treatment in the country and is now expanding its continuum of behavioral health services, with its newest addition of the Intensive Outpatient Program. The agency treats over 5,500 clients per day within its network of nine statewide clinics.

Position Summary

The Human Resources (HR) Assistant supports the Human Resources Department by coordinating and administrating duties related to benefits, status changes, employee inquiries, policies, procedures, which may include, but not limited to the following: typing, filing, answering telephones, customer service, and researching/resolving employee information requests. Work performed with autonomy and/or under the direction of the Human Resources Director.

Essential Functions

The HR Assistant is responsible for, but not limited to, the following:

  • Prepares Various Documents ; Accurately and promptly types correspondence and memos including change of status, terminations, etc. Keeps and types minutes for Human Resources staff meetings. Provides some clerical support to the HR Director.
  • Worker's Compensation ; Coordinates, complies and completes state reporting, claim management and employee injury reporting within appropriate time frames.
  • Record Keeping ; Accurately inputs and maintains information in Warning Log, retrieves information for internal applicants for transfer eligibility, annual performance reviews, and upon department head requests.
  • Employment Verifications ; Completes employment verifications within 24 hours of receipt.
  • Monthly Reports ; Performs monthly reports of OIG Monthly Exclusion Check and OIG Annual Checks; Per State requirements, keep accurate files to ensure compliance.
  • I-9 Compliance ; Validates and maintains all I-9 forms in accordance with state and federal regulations. Follows up on expiration dates and obtains evidence of ability to continue employment in the US prior to any expiration dates.
  • Documentation and Filing ; Accurately and promptly files employee information in personnel files, medical files, and confidential files on a weekly basis and maintains state regulatory standards.
  • Confidentiality ; Maintains confidentiality of personnel files, all related employee information and inquiries.
  • Corporate Compliance ; Works in accordance with all corporate compliance policies.

Education, Licensure & Experience

Bachelor's degree with a minimum of six months Human Resources experience. Ability to exhibit a high level of confidentiality is a must.

Employee Benefits

To continually promote health and wellness to employees, Hartford Dispensary offers a generous and comprehensive benefit package including:

  • Flexibility: Great work life balance with clinics closed on Sundays, twelve paid holidays, and no current on-call responsibilities
  • Competitive salary and scheduled time off: vacation time, twelve sick days per year, and personal days
  • Insurance package offering exceptional medical, dental, prescription and vision coverage
  • Retirement plan: company matching 403B with a 5% match after 6 months of employment and up to 10% employer match after two years.
  • Professional Growth program providing continuing education, training reimbursement, and certification and license reimbursements

When you apply for this job, you will be asked to answer questions regarding your criminal background. Answering “Yes” to the criminal background questions will not automatically bar you from employment. A criminal background check will be conducted following any conditional offer of employment. Only those crimes which are substantially related to the position you are seeking will be considered. Please note that for certain contractors with whom we do business, based on the nature of their operation, the type of offense and related factors may affect your assignment to that contractor. Factors that will be taken into account include: (1) The facts or circumstances surrounding the offense or conduct; (2) the number of offenses for which you were convicted or plea was entered; (3) your age at the time of conviction or plea, or release from prison; (4) any evidence that you performed the same or similar type of work, post conviction/plea, with the same or different employers, with no known incidents of criminal conduct; (5) the length and consistency of employment history before and after the offense or conduct; (6) any rehabilitation efforts, e.g. education/training; (7) any employment or character references and any other information regarding your fitness for the particular position; and/or (8) whether you are bonded under a federal, state, or local bonding program.

Job Summary

Sunniva is a major leader in the medical cannabis industry in the US. We are constantly seeking high calibre talent who bring excellence and enthusiasm to our growing operations. We continue to attract top tier talent and leadership who share a common belief in building relationships that are fueled by constant healthy questioning, innovation, knowledge expansion and continuous knowledge.

We are seeking a Master Grower - Greenhouse to join our team at our Cathedral City location at California.

The Master Grower is responsible for the performance of specialized horticultural duties involved in the planning, preparation, oversight and maintenance of greenhouse plant production. The Master Grower will effectively manage the horticultural activities of growers and growing assistants, planning projects, scheduling works and completing tasks within specified timelines and on budget. He or she will also undertake the research and analysis of horticultural problems, providing advanced technical support to all greenhouse personnel and management. Other duties will be assigned as necessary.

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Coordinate and participate in the planning and care of Greenhouse production.
  • Inspect assigned areas for plant damage, disease.
  • Identify plants, insects, pests and diseases as appropriate.
  • Recommend corrective actions such as removal of plants or remedial treatments as appropriate.
  • Provide advanced technical guidance to Greenhouse personnel in the proper maintenance and care of mothers, propagations, young plants and flowering crops.
  • Assist in the development and implementation of new production plans.
  • Maintain field and project maintenance records as directed; prepare reports and analyses as requested by management.
  • Observe that Work Safe Practices are being followed.
  • Verify the accuracy of change orders and ensures change orders are signed by the client.
  • Manage project activities throughout lifecycle, including the allocation of adequate resources, scheduling, documentation, budget, and other factors necessary for success.
  • Organize project teams into suitable workgroups and guide the teams throughout their efforts to produce deliverables according to specification.
  • Track all project costs to ensure completion within budget; procure extra budget funding where necessary.
  • Manage project dependencies.
  • Conduct project post mortems in order to identify areas for improvement; make recommendations based on findings.
  • Plan, coordinate and/or supervise activities of all company personnel on assigned project(s).
  • Authorize/approve all project personnel transactions, purchase requisitions, change requests, etc.
  • Ensure all company, client, and project policies, procedures, standards, etc., are adhered to.
  • Participate in the selection, hiring and training of new staff.
  • Provide appropriate levels of motivation for staff.
  • Resolve employee issues and use appropriate levels of corrective actions.

Qualifications and Skills

  • University degree in a relevant field like Botany, Horticulture or Agriculture
  • 10+ yearsâ€™ work experience in horticulture
  • Ability to read blueprints, schematics, field drawings and plans.
  • A solid understanding of horticultural techniques.
  • Experienced with Integrated Pest Management (IPM) and yield optimization.
  • Strong management, delegation, planning and leadership skills.
  • Effectiveness in safety and productivity.
  • Knowledge of local, state and federal workplace compliance regulations, ordinances and legislation.
  • Commitment to working in a team environment, with established team building abilities.
  • Strong communication, leadership, integration, problem-solving and interpersonal skills.
  • Strong understanding of yield optimization and integrated pest management standards
  • Ability to participate in continuous improvement processes.
  • An interest in plants of different kinds and the environment in which they thrive.
  • Good observation skills.
  • Ability to follow safe procedures for use of fertilizers, pesticides, fungicides and herbicides.
  • Some background in science and basic mathematical skills.
  • Results-oriented individual with the ability to interpret and effectively manage multiple and competing priorities and time lines.
  • Highly effective negotiation, diplomatic, and conflict resolutions skills.
  • Able to effectively communicate with all types of staff, including laborers, technical, professional, and upper management.
  • Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing.
  • Able to build and maintain lasting relationships with business units, corporate departments, key managers, and other stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated ability to exercise necessary cost control measures.
  • Strong working knowledge of Microsoft computer software (e.g. Excel, Word, etc.) and email.
  • First Aid skills and/or certificates are considered assets.
  • Flexibility to adjust to shifting priorities and deadlines.

Sunniva offers a competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefit plan.

the position will be contacted.

Job Summary

Reporting to the Vice President of Operations and working with the Lab Directors, the Facilities Manager is responsible for managing the leasing, design, planning, construction and maintenance of lab facilities and other buildings. Manage project budgets and timelines. Tasks include support and monitoring of equipment performance and maintenance, proposal & development of equipment and facility improvements. Actively ensures reliability, safety, environmental, and operating cost goals are achieved.

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Work with management to identify sites, perform lease negotiations; develop plans, budgets and schedules.
  • Determine facility modifications, including estimates on equipment, labor materials and other related costs.
  • Oversee the coordination of building space allocation and layout, communication, electrical and HVAC services, and facility expansion.
  • Interface with architects, general contractors and local building inspectors.
  • Manage planned maintenance programs for a variety of office and laboratory equipment.
  • Frequently interacts with contractors, architects and vendors, representing the interests of the company throughout the project.
  • Participates in the design, development, implementation of programs, policies and procedures to ensure all facilities (building, structures, systems, equipment, furnishings and physical environment) and grounds are maintained in an operationally effective, clean and safe manner.
  • Assist with ensuring compliance with administrative, legal and regulatory requirements of governmental and accrediting agencies.
  • Schedules, manages, documents, and maintains records of a comprehensive preventive maintenance program.
  • Ensures the site is in compliance with fire prevention, general safety, seismic conformance, health hazards protection and disaster/emergency preparedness plans.
  • Writes reports, memos, operating procedures and correspondence as required or directed.
  • Travel to all laboratory sites may be required.
  • Responds to emergencies as appropriate during off-hours, holidays and weekends.
  • Manage receiving, engage with third parties such as cleaning services.

Qualifications and Skills

Qualifications and Skills

  • Bachelor's degree in business administration, public health, engineering or related field OR equivalent work experience in facility maintenance/management industry or directly related experience.
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in managing facility operations for a multi-sited organization, maintenance, renovation and related activities.
  • Background in facility management, construction management and project management preferred.
  • Excellent business judgement.
  • Space planning and forecasting skills.
  • Must function effectively under time constraints, schedule workload to meet deadlines, and have the ability to prioritize.
  • The ideal candidate has prior experience in facilities management, project management or construction management, preferably in laboratory settings.

Working Conditions

  • Working conditions include general office and cannabis testing laboratory environments. Some travel may be required. Occasional evening and weekend hours may be required.

Physical Requirements

  • The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  • While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, stand, speak and hear. The employee is frequently required to walk, use hands and fingers to handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms. The position requires occasional use of ladders and lifts. May also need to climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. Will need to lift up to 25 lbs as it relates to building maintenance activities. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and distance vision.

Benefits

Paid Vacation, Paid Holidays, Company Group Health Plan with Vision plus Dental, Employee Stock Option Incentive Plan. Compensation commensurate with experience.

Any individual offered employment will be required to pass a pre-employment hair drug test, complete background check, and may be required to demonstrate the ability to perform the physical requirements of the job." Some positions may require preliminary background checks.Conducts inspections of businesses and investigates computer-based advertisements for business license compliance; enforces licensing ordinances and regulations; investigates general and privileged license problems and complaints, including zoning and nuisance violations; conducts interviews and issues warning notices and criminal and civil citations; performs undercover operations; initiates court action and testifies in court and civil hearings; and performs related paperwork and data maintenance. Distinguishing Characteristics This is the full journey level class within the License Officer series assigned to the Compliance and Enforcement unit.  Employees perform the full range of duties as assigned including independently conducting investigations and field inspections of businesses for business license, zoning, and nuisance compliance, informing the public of code requirements and initiating and following through on enforcement actions that may include court action.  Employees at this level receive only occasional instruction or assistance as new or unusual situations arise, and are fully aware of the operating procedures and policies of the work unit. Supervision Received Receives general supervision from higher level supervisory or management staff. EXAMPLE OF DUTIES Essential Functions: Conducts on-site compliance inspections of commercial and in-home businesses as necessary to issue general and privileged licenses; investigates licenses problems and complaints; interviews complainants and witnesses; collects information and documents violations; prepares written reports and spreadsheets based on findings; conducts follow up inspections; issues warnings, notices, and criminal and civil citations; assesses re-inspection fees. Reviews site plans and special use permit requirements to verify compliance with land use and licensing conditions.  Performs all needed research and enforcement to ensure compliance with applicable codes and ordinances. Issues misdemeanor citations or infraction to offenders, appear in court, give legal depositions, provides witness information, prepares administrative search warrants, prepares summon and complaint affidavits as required by City Attorney. Prepares timely case reports for court, civil hearings, and administrative proceedings; testifies in court, in civil hearings, and at administrative proceedings as necessary. Conducts investigation of computer-based advertising, businesses and activities to ensure compliance with business licensing ordinances.  Performs online research to identify and locate commercial activities within the Las Vegas area. Provides timely and relevant information to supervisor and management staff, qualified law enforcement and other licensing agencies concerning the enforcement of state and local licensing laws. Forwards information related to criminal activities to the appropriate law enforcement agencies. Utilizes a computer-based system to store, process, and analyze business activity. Operates and maintains automated systems; builds interoperability and exchanges confidential information with other agencies. Participates in facilitating the general and privileged license application and renewal process, researching background information on the business, conducting inspections, processing documentation, and facilitating administrative action taken on an application. Provides responsible customer service to the public and other city staff; interprets and explains city business licensing ordinances and regulations, either in person, in writing, or on the telephone; responds to questions, complaints, and violations and resolve problems, including coordinating responses with various affected city departments. Determines correct licensing categories based upon inspection of business premises. Acts as a liaison to the division; responds to requests from various other city divisions; coordinates the routing of licensing information to applicable divisions. Represents the division in various committees and work groups. Participates in the enforcement of zoning codes. Maintains files of ongoing inspections and other business license activities; compiles and enters data and statistics on inspections into computer systems; prepares and presents a variety of written reports. Shares technical knowledge with employees in inspection and investigative methods and techniques in general and privileged licensing, and in techniques for handling customers, including difficult customers. Participates in special community events.  Prepares and presents presentations to the public about business licensing, zoning, and nuisance codes and ordinances and related city resources. Operates and secures assigned vehicles and other assigned equipment; determines whether vehicle is in good working orders; maintains vehicle in clean and fueled condition. Attends pre-application meetings as needed; assists with building plan review and provides technical advice on business licensing code compliance. Performs related duties and responsibilities as required. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS Experience: Two years of work experience which required the frequent interpretation, explanation or enforcement of varied codes and regulations, including one year of frequent, heavy public contact.  Business license or business inspection experience is desirable. Training: Associate's degree from an accredited college with major course work in business management, criminal justice, or a related field. A combination of formal education and directly related work experience may substitute for the degree. The city assesses 1.5 years of fulltime experience as equivalent to one year of education.License or Certificate Possession of an appropriate, valid driver's license on the date of application, and maintenance thereafter. Special Requirements Certain city functions operate on a 24 hour per day, seven day per week schedule, and may require support on any shift. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES Knowledge of: Principles and methods of personal computer usage.Techniques of online research and investigation.Mathematical principles.Interviewing techniques.Customer service principles and practices.Modern office procedures, methods and computer and office equipment.Principles and procedures of record keeping.Principles of business letter writing and basic report preparation.Safety and health standards as applicable to business licensing activities.Methods of business activities, marketing and business licensing procedures.Investigative and inspection methods and techniques.Methods and techniques of conflict resolution.Laws, codes and regulations applicable to general business and privileged licensing.Zoning and nuisance requirements.Basic collection procedures and techniques.Accounting procedures and practices.Operational characteristics, services and activities of a license officer program. Skills in: Interpreting and enforcing applicable rules and regulations governing general and privileged business licensing, zoning and nuisance requirements.Demonstrating effective problem solving skills and uses sound judgment when making decision.Operating a personal computer and office equipment, including a variety of software programs.Conducting online research.Navigating through various social media websites.Documenting research results and preparing technical reports.Communicating effectively with irate customers in sensitive situations.Responding to potentially confrontational situations.Establishing and meeting critical deadlines, compiling and collecting data, establishing priorities, organizing workload, and conducting necessary follow up activities with minimal supervision.Using investigative and inspection methods and techniques.Detecting inconsistent or suspect information provided by customer that may warrant further investigation.Understanding and following oral and written instructions.Making computations rapidly and accurately.Communicating clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.Establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with those contacted in the course of work.Working independently in the absence of supervision. Ability to: Work with confidential information and other enforcement agencies such as the Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department, Drug Enforcement Administration, Department of Justice, State Gaming Control Board, or other jurisdictions on cases with mutual interest.Work effectively in various environments which may include the presence of alcohol, tobacco, medical marijuana, sexually oriented settings, literature and merchandise, and other potentially unlawful activities.Competencies: Core Workforce Competencies Professionalism – Demonstrates core values by being honest, respectful and positive. Effective Communication – Expresses verbal and written thought in a clear and understandable manner. Job Summary

As a Fiscal Analyst 2 you will support the mission of the agency by performing professional journey level financial review and analysis of accounting, auditing and fiscal data in accordance with General Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), governmental auditing standards, statutes or regulations. This position reports to the Marijuana Tax Unit Supervisor and works on the cutting edge of Washington State's efforts to responsibly tax and regulate the new marijuana industry.To be successful in this role, there are three main areas you will need to excel. First, you need to be incredibly detail-oriented as a significant portion of this job involves reviewing and analyzing financial reports for missing and inaccurate data. In addition, you will need to quickly build a strong understanding of the RCWs and WACs relating to marijuana tax, privilege activity, and reporting compliance and build a reputation within the agency as an expert in those areas. Finally, you need to be passionate about delivering excellent customer service as the first point of contact for marijuana licensees across the state seeking to accurately report their sales in the state tracking system. If being a detail-driven, customer-service-oriented expert in marijuana tax code sounds like something you would enjoy, we would strongly encourage you to apply to be a part of our work here at WSLCB.

Responsibilities and Duties

Fiscal Analyst 2 (Marijuana Tax Unit)

  • Process financial data according to accounting performance standards.
  • Verify monthly reports in Tax System and verify accuracy of all data posted.
  • Assist licensees with the Traceability System.
  • First level responder to payment room activity and the main telephone line for the Tax Unit.
  • Prepare batch, scanning and indexing of monthly tax reports and payment.
  • Prepare invoices and track receipt of payment for initial approved marijuana license fees.
  • Tasks include:
  • Receipt and process cash and checks from application fees and tax payments in secure payment room.
  • Review, code, batch, process and enter tax payments in accounting system
  • ACH payment coding review, email sweep summary and enter payments into payment log.
  • Record NSF ACH / checks in accounting system. Prepare JV's to record NSF.
  • Back-up for coding General Accounting payment log and email, enter payments into MJ payment log.
  • Reconciliation - prepare month end reconciliation for bank or Great Plains ("GP")
  • Review and process incoming mail for the Tax Unit, distributing to appropriate staff.
  • Batch, scan and index tax obligation report with any backup into a document management system
  • Maintain tax obligation report to determine that licensees have completed their monthly reports and validate outstanding taxes.
  • Waiver process review and email correspondence.
  • Prepare weekly and track invoices for license fees.
  • Prepare new license invoice, track payment, complete process and distribute new licensee correspondence (e.g. welcome package)
  • Assist with the monthly close and reconciliation of Accounting System by reviewing AFRS and compare to data that was submitted to General Accounting.
  • Respond to inquiries from external customers, fiscal staff, WSLCB auditors, WSLCB licensing division, WSLCB enforcement division and WSLCB licensees with interpretation of RCWs and WACs related to excise tax reporting, privilege activity and tax system(s)
  • Tasks include:
  • First line responder to answer and respond to voicemails received on main Tax Unit phone line
  • Contact with licensee to schedule monthly payment appointments as needed. Coordinate monthly email to licensees with payment room schedule.
  • Respond to email and correspondence regarding reporting, e-filing, and general inquiries from internal and external customers.
  • Interpret RCWs and WACs related to Marijuana Tax reporting.
  • Review, research and recommend website updates.
  • Review, research and recommend accounting system process changes

Qualifications and Skills

Required Qualifications :

  • A bachelor's degree, which includes 18 quarter or 12 semester hours in accounting, and one year of relevant professional experience.

OR

  • Any combination of education and relevant professional experience totaling five years. Education must include the required credit hours in accounting.
  • Intermediate skill level using Microsoft Word & Excel.

Ability to:

  • Explain tax accounting standards and WSLCB policies to customers outside of the financial division;
  • Explain reporting requirements to external customers;
  • Help customers navigate a personal computer to submit reports electronically;
  • Become proficient in WSLCB Traceability System; Microsoft Dynamics GP; and Document Management System; internal LCB systems
  • Learn telephone system.
  • Stand for long periods of time receipting cash

Knowledge of:

  • Washington Administrative Codes WAC 314-55-089; 314-55-092

Preferred/Desired Qualifications :

  • A Bachelor's Degree in accounting or related field.
  • Knowledge, understanding, and ability to ensure work products are in compliance with agency policies and OFM State Administrative and Accounting Manual (SAAM).
  • Experience in the following programs: Enterprise Reporting, AFRS, Tool Box, Mainframe System
  • Advance excel skills for pivot tables and understanding formulas
  • Great Plains Dynamics experience â€“ AR module
  • Six months experience working with customers with on-line applications and troubleshooting technical issues.
  • Six months experience assisting customers with on-line reporting requirements and questions

Plus Bonus and Benefits

POSITION

Our growing company is in search of a self-directed and experienced Assistant Controller/Full Charge Bookkeeper Professional to assist the Chief Financial Officer in directing the organization's accounting functions (multiple entities), as well as performing and/or supervising our day-to-day accounting, finance, and inventory control. This is a fantastic opportunity for a professional who thrives in a busy, family-friendly workplace, and who is also well-versed in working closely with senior management.

The person hired for this position will thrive working independently, but will also possess an understanding of the necessity of teamwork within a smaller company in order to support the overall growth and success of the organization. They will have a desire to strive for improvement and progress, but will also be patient with the timeframe it often takes to implement effective changes. They will be highly detail oriented, will practice discretion in all corporate matters, and will place accuracy in work as a top priority. Upholding the company's positive image, all while maintaining an upbeat, positive spirited, and helpful attitude, is a requirement for any person in this position.

The successful candidate will be drawn to the fluidity and pace of a start-up venture, will be comfortable with navigating complexity, and have a driving passion for the cannabis industry and its advocacy. The ideal candidate will also have the vision, leadership, and capacity to contribute at the Senior Management level.

This position is based in Sacramento and reports to the Chief Financial Officer. Compensation includes a competitive base salary commensurate with experience; as well as, bonuses based on company sales and overall profitability, employer contributed health benefits package, and cell phone allowance.

Transactions:

- BOOKKEEPER -

jobDescription:
Job Summary

Our Site: GivingTree Wellness Center of North Phoenix

Who Are We? www.givingtreeaz.com & www.kindredgrown.com

Our Mission: Improving the life & happiness of all

The Giving Tree Wellness Center is a leading Arizona Licensed Medical Marijuana Dispensary. We opened our doors in May 2013. At Giving Tree, we work with medical professionals collaboratively to help certified patients access high quality medical cannabis. The Giving Tree is looking for an organized, efficient, professional individual with excellent customer service skills to work part time as one of our Security Officers.

Must be able to work the following days/hours: Thursdays 9:30 a.m.- 7:30 pm; Fridays 7:30 a.m. - 7:30 p.m. and Sat. 9:30 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Security personnel must wear a valid and current Dispensary Agent card, which is visible at all times
  • Responsible for the protection and safety of clientele, employees and company assets from theft, assault, fire, and other safety concerns
  • Responds immediately to security related incidents, and provides detailed post-event analysis and serious incident reports
  • Physical inspection of the property at the beginning and end of each workday for any physical abnormalities or apparent anomalies
  • Physical inspection of all security cameras, door alarms and access control areas to ensure that they are each in good working condition. Inspection of the security system will be performed every morning and evening with one of the Director who will be monitoring the system off-site but on-line as the security employee is inspecting the premises
  • Report any anomalies in the physical structure of the building or any defect or breach in the security system to the Directors and security company monitoring GTWC
  • Ensure that no patients enter or leave GTWC if there is any breach in the physical plant or security system while the patients are inside
  • Ensure that NO ONE aside from the Director and police enter the building if a security breach occurs before business hours. The Director will supervise any investigation of a breach that is led by the security company
  • Supervise loading of all shipments from the cultivation center to be sent for deliveries or to other dispensaries and sign off that all shipments are accurate in terms of times, weight and personnel sending and receiving the shipments
  • Monitor patients through the metal detector in to the Dispensary Waiting Area
  • Wand/pat-down any patient not clearing through the metal detector
  • Ensure that only one person proceeds into the dispensary at any time and that all patients entering the dispensary pass through a metal detector or receive a pat down and wand
  • Report any suspicious activity by patients or employees to the Directors for immediate security camera review
  • Assist with shipping and receiving as needed
  • Assist the Front Desk Receptionist as needed

Qualifications and Skills

  • All security personnel will have to take and pass a security guard training course. They will be required to re-train every 12 months and keep a record of their training certificate on file at the Dispensary at all times.
  • No excluded felony offense per ARS 36-2801
  • High School Diploma or GED required
  • Must be 21 years of age
  • Prior Security Office experience is preferred

Training and adherence to confidentiality requirements

All security officers must read, be familiar with and abide by all aspects of ARS 36 Chapter 28.1 (The Arizona Medical Marijuana Act) and AAC Title 9 Chapter 17 (The Department of Health Services Medical Marijuana Program Rules).

Benefits

  • discount on products
  • accrued sick time based on hours worked
  • monthly birthday and anniversary celebrations

Job Description

Built around a portfolio of recognized brands, Golden Leaf Holdings, Inc. (GLH) is one of the largest cannabis oil and solution providers in North America. The Company leverages a strong management team with cannabis and food industry experience to complement its expertise in the extracting, refining and selling of cannabis oil, edibles and flower products. The Company has developed a strong consumer brand portfolio ("Golden Brands") that includes the Golden, Proper, Chalice Farms, Liberty Reach and Jackpot Seaweek brands. In addition to leading branded products, GLH also maintains a foothold in the Oregon retail dispensary market with its award-winning chain of Chalice Farms retail stores.

We are looking for an experienced Retail Store Manager, to join our grown retail team and oversee the daily operations of a designated retail store. You will be the one to ensure the smooth running of operations to maximize sales and minimize costs. The ideal candidate will have prior experience as a store manager and knowledge of diverse business subjects such as sales, marketing, etc. An effective retail store manager will also be able to motivate team members to perform to the best of their ability. The goal is to manage our stores in ways that boost revenues, develop business and maintain compliance.

Retail Store Manager Responsibilities (include, but are not limited to the following):

  • Maintain and protect store assets, facilities, and team members by ensuring all team members' adherence to operational guidelines and standards, compliance with al safety and security policies, the proper functioning and maintenance of store equipment, and performance of all financial transactions according to the Cash Handling Policy.
  • Managing an ensuring store compliance at all times.
  • Hiring, training, developing and motivating team members.
  • Create and maintain training program and weekly schedules for retail employees.
  • Lead store by delegating duties, assigning tasks, and following up with all team members.
  • Demonstrate ownership of the store by ensuring cleanliness, organization, and attractiveness of store's interior and exterior and a professional personal appearance.
  • Execute and drive all sales promotions effectively and efficiently.
  • Track and maintain product promotions.
  • Weekly inventory audits and tracking/ordering of product from purchasing department.
  • Leading excellent customer service through in-the-moment coaching, role modeling, and utilizing customer feedback to reinforce and improve quality of service.
  • Manage daily POS and METRC reporting.
  • Follow inventory control procedures to reduce product loss.
  • Contributes to team effort through accomplishing related results as needed on a timely basis.
  • Complete duties within the monthly budget.
  • Ensure effective succession planning by identifying and developing future leaders with an interest and potential to grow.
  • Being a champion of Chalice Farms inside and outside of the store.

Qualifications and Key Competencies

While there is no single recipe for an excellent Retail Store Manager, the following are qualities and experiences we recognize as contributing to the success of our best Retail Store Managers:

  • 21 years of age or older
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Minimum 2 years proven retail management experience (including hiring and termination)
  • OLCC Marijuana Worker's Permit
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills - you are energized by working with people; both guests and team members
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite
  • Experience with BioTrack THC and/or METRC preferred
  • Attention to detail, punctual and dependable
  • A bias towards action - you are an owner who does not hesitate to roll up your sleeves and do whatever it takes to get the job done
  • The desire to coach and mentor - you see potential in your team and enjoy growing and fostering that potential
  • The ability to multitask with strong attention to detail
  • Ability to listen and take directions quickly

Interested candidates should submit a cover letter and resume for consideration.

companyName: The GivingTree Wellness Center, N. Phoenix
jobDescription:
Job Summary

Assistant Dispensary Manager

The Giving Tree Wellness Center is a leading Arizona Licensed Medical Marijuana Dispensary. At Giving Tree, we work with medical professionals collaboratively to help certified patients access high quality medical cannabis. The Giving Tree is looking for an organized, efficient, professional individual who possesses excellent hospitality, customer service skills and who has exceptional leadership capabilities, and proven retail management experience for our Assistant Dispensary Manager position at our Phoenix, AZ location. The Assistant Dispensary Manager plays a vital role in being the connector point between management and all other staff. They are responsible for the daily operations of the Medical Marijuana Dispensary including but not limited to: strict adherence to compliance policies and laws, MED paperwork, sales, cash handling processes, financial reporting, inventory management, vendor relationships, customer service, regulatory compliance, patient communications, patient education, and patient information management, operating under the highest standards. Additionally, you will be working as a Lead Patient Consultant on certain days as needed.

Responsibilities and Duties

Responsibilities:

  • Customer Care and Patient Satisfaction.
  • Assist the Store Manager in organizing, planning and implementing strategy
  • Leading the Patient Consultant Team in all daily operations of the business and to support, inspire, connect and develop leadership skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills with patients, to evaluate their needs and specifications
  • Continuous and positive communication skills with team members, managers and owners.
  • Ensures compliance objectives are met
  • Executes the mission, vision, values of The Giving Tree Wellness Center
  • Training & development of the staff
  • Cash handling
  • Support the Shift Leads and scheduling breaks
  • Open and close Dispensary
  • Maintain positive vendor relationships
  • Identify solutions that decrease waste, increase efficiency and positively impact the bottom line
  • Emergency shift coverage
  • Overall facility management and maintenance

Qualifications and Skills

  • 2-3 years of hotel, restaurant or customer facing experience. Retail experience preferred.
  • Minimum 2 years of management in a customer facing environment
  • Must be able to weekends and holidays
  • Cash handling
  • Familiar with financial and customer service principles and practices
  • Good math skills
  • Proficient user of MS Office and Excel
  • Outstanding leadership and organizational abilities
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Bachelor's degree is Required
  • Must read, be familiar with and abide by all aspects of ARS 36 Chapter 28.1 (The Arizona Medical Marijuana Act) and AAC Title 9 Chapter 17 (The Department of Health Services Medical Marijuana Program Rules).

Benefits

  • 5 days PTO after 90 days / 10 days at completion of 1 year
  • Health insurance after 60 days
  • 401K/Profit Sharing after1 year
  • Several Paid Holidays (3)
  • Discounts on products
  • Monthly company paid lunches
  • Fun community events

Salary: $19.00 /hour
