Position Summary:

Cultivators are responsible for executing production plans in keeping with the Companyâ€™s operating procedures. Cultivators carry out the day-to-day assignments and tasks of the medical Cannabis production cycle. Company operates under the highest standards of professionalism.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Cultivators are responsible for executing production plans in keeping with the Companyâ€™s operating procedures. Cultivators carry out the day-to-day assignments and tasks of the medical Cannabis production cycle. Company operates under the highest standards of professionalism.

  • Cloning: cutting, rooting and transplanting; clone care, watering and feeding; clone monitoring and climate control; pest and disease control; labeling; and inventory data input.
  • Plant monitoring and care during vegetative and flowering phase: trimming, manipulating and staking; big leafing and pruning; plant care, watering and feeding; plant monitoring and climate control; pest and disease control; inventory data input.
  • Harvesting: cutting plants; trimming cut plants; removing flowering tops; weighing and inventory data input into the electronic inventory tracking system.
  • Curing: hanging and dry-racking flowers; monitoring curing process and climate control; labeling; weighing and inventory data input.
  • Operating and maintaining cultivation systems/equipment: monitoring, calibrating, running and maintaining lighting, irrigation, climate control and other cultivation systems; stocking and handling production inputs and supplies; sanitizing and cleaning growing rooms, cultivation workspaces and tools.
  • Packaging and Trimming may be needed during peak times.
  • Any other tasks assigned by Management.
  • Quality control for the position and the Cultivation Team

Education and Qualification Requirements:

  • Must understand and implement the rules, regulations, policies, and procedures set forth by the state; a pursuit to further their understanding and knowledge of the industry and laws is appreciated and commendable.
  • Fundamental knowledge, as well as the ability to be taught and guided in areas related to harvesting, drying, trimming and curing.
  • Skill in analyzing potential problems with a plant or the product being processed.
  • Maintain a clean and organized work environment.
  • Physical aptitude and health necessary to perform manual labor tasks required for the proper management of grow warehouse.
  • Must have accountability, proactive behavior and strong attention to detail.
  • Two or four year college degree preferred; 1-3 experience

Job Requirements:

  • You are at least 21 years of age.
  • You have no felony convictions
  • You are willing to participate in an extensive background check
  • You are trustworthy and hardworking
  • You have reliable transportation

Skills & Abilities:

  • Excellent time-management skills
  • Ability to effectively plan and prioritize
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality
  • Ability to focus; attention to detail
  • Ability to communicate clearly and calmly
  • Skills at using computers, web browsers, Google Apps
  • Ability to remain calm in periods of high stress or unusual activity
  • Absolute reliability and honesty

Physical Requirements:

  • Extended time standing, sitting, walking, bending and reaching
  • Required to stand for extended periods of time, lifting of objects on a regular basis, and daily repetitive tasks.
  • Close visual focus required
  • This position requires the extended and repetitive use of arms, hands and fingers to cut and manipulate small objects
  • Ability to lift and carry up to 50 pounds for a distance of 100 feet

This is the 3rd Dispensary course of 2018 since California's new medical and adult-use program has gone into effect.  Expect a lot of new regulatory information and job opportunities with licensed businesses to exist.  Our course is taught inside the Green Trea Collective, which is located in the heart of LA's fasion and dispensary district.  Students will have the opportunity to tour the dispensary room, interface with friendly budtenders and purchase discounted products.

When is the course?  Sunday April 8th, 2018 - 1:00 pm to 4:00 pm
Cost?  $99
To Register:  https://www.eventbrite.com/e/los-angeles-cannabis-dispensary-certification-course-budtender-job-training-tickets-43366863456

What does the Dispensary Staff training course cover?

-Proper use of security measures, procedures for responding to an emergency.
-Community impact.
-Quality, care and safekeeping of product.
-Testing and verifying marijuana.
-Transportation.
-Incoming marijuana.
-Packaging and labeling.
-Procedures for dispensing marijuana and electronic verification.
-Patient Education plan
-Recordkeeping plan

BONUS:  BUDTENDER JOB TRAINING (HANDS-ON)

-How to safely dispense cannabis
-Analyzing marijuana test results
-Recommending ailment specific strains


DOUBLE BONUS: Access to discounted medical and recreational products for Trim Ready graduates.

FAQs 

Do I get a certificate?

Yes, all Trim Ready certification courses come with a certificate.  You also will be added to our list of graduates and will receive emails regarding job placement.  We do recommend that graduates update their resume and cover letter to include their most recent certification under the education/skills section.

Does my certification work in other states?

Yes, TRIM READY™ certifications are accepted as professional achievements/technical training in most marijuana legal states and any state we do business in.  (Nevada, California, Hawaii and Florida).  After graduation, please follow the proper steps of updating your resume and cover letter so we can be reached in case your employer is requesting a verification or vocational reference.

Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?

There is no age requirement to attend the course, although the state you choose to work in might have age restrictions on working in a licensed cannabis facility.

Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?

Please email or call us.

Is my registration/ticket transferrable?

Your ticket can be transferred to another date.

Can I update my registration information?

Yes, either through the eventbrite website or by contacting Trim Ready.

Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?

Yes, for verification purposes.

What is the refund policy?

There is no refund, but you can transfer your ticket to a future date.

-Providing the sales team with any other support they may need

-Prior experience with the medical marijuana industry a major plus
-Experience with Salesforce and Excel a plus

-Excellent attention to detail (this role will require important data entry so accuracy is critical)

-Maintaining regular communication with clients on a weekly, bi-weekly, and monthly basis
-Answering customer service inquiries over the phone, email, and social media
-Participating in on-site patient appreciation days, budtender education events, hosted parties, and other events on an as-needed basis
-Processing orders received from sales and generating invoices
-Confirming order details with clients to ensure accuracy and completeness
-Monitoring the status of deliveries and staying in regular communication with clients, salespeople, and warehouse fulfillment staff to ensure deadlines are met
-Monitoring all customer service channels (voicemail, email, social media) and communicating sales inquiries, marketing support requests, and potential issues with salespeople as they come in
-Reaching out to clients on an as-needed basis to inform them about new products, special delivery schedules, and other important updates
-Providing the sales team with any other support they may need

Skills & Experience
-Minimum one year prior experience with customer service, data entry, or account management required
-Prior experience with the medical marijuana industry a major plus
-Experience with Salesforce and Excel a plus
-Responsibility & accountability (you must take ownership of your accounts and all issues related to them)
-Excellent attention to detail (this role will require important data entry so accuracy is critical)
-Exceptional communication and customer service skills, including a patient attitude, a friendly disposition, and a willingness to go the extra mile for our customers
-A team spirit and helpful attitude

TO APPLY: PLEASE ATTACH YOUR RESUME AND TWO REFERENCES

Who are we?
We are a state-compliant producer of premium cannabis concentrates, and one of the fastest growing and most respected cannabis brands in the nation.

What will you do?
Sales Representative will be responsible for prospecting and closing new business via cold-calling, in-store presentations, and participation in industry trade shows and networking events.

You would be working for an established company with an award-winning product line and a well-known brand. You will also receive extensive support from our account management and marketing teams, ensuring you have all the tools you need to close sales and build a successful career in the cannabis industry.

Responsibilities
-Prospect new accounts using WeedMaps, social media, and other online tools
-Set up meetings with dispensary purchasing managers via cold-calling, email, and social media outreach
-Visit dispensaries on a daily basis to drop off samples, understand customer pain points and desires, and make sales presentations
-Use a customer-focused, consultative sales process to educate prospects on what products will best fit their needs
-Follow-up with prospective accounts via phone, email and SMS to stay top of mind and close new business
-Collaborate with our account management team to ensure a seamless onboarding experience for new clients
-Participate in on-site patient appreciation days, budtender education events, hosted company parties, networking mixers, and other events on a regular basis
-Respond to phone and email inquiries in a timely, efficient and professional manner
-Maintain expert-level knowledge on our full product catalog as well as the latest trends in the cannabis industry
-Work with the marketing team to develop new sales material and refine messaging
-Relay feedback from customers to the marketing, product and account management teams on a regular basis
-Maintain customer databases and ensure that all information is up-to-date and accurate

Skills & Experience
-Minimum one year of experience in a field sales position
-Prior experience in the medical marijuana industry required
-High school diploma or equivalent required; bachelor's degree a plus
-Proven track record of developing a strategic sales strategy, building new business, and meeting/exceeding quotas
-Excellent verbal and written communication, presentation, negotiation, and interpersonal skills
-Must have a valid California driver's license, a reliable vehicle, insurance, and a clean driving and criminal record (this position will require extensive travel)
-Proven ability to work effectively in a team environment
-Proficient technical skills including use of MS Office, Google Drive, and CRM software

Benefits
-Competitive pay and commission
-Paid training
-Company-provided cell phone
-Paid holidays and vacation days
-Professional development and advancement opportunities

Job Summary

Apothecary, the new standard in licensed dispensaries is now searching for individuals to expand our team. We are seeking hip and talented individuals with a keen sense of appropriate professional demeanor and dress for an upscale dispensary. We expect exceptional customer service skills with experience within the cannabis industry, or as an alternative, a strong background in hospitality, retail merchandising or management outside the industry.
In order to be considered for employment, please read this ENTIRE post and carefully follow the directions below:
All interested applicants, please respond through this ad. Please email your resume in a reply to this post to be considered for an interview. In the subject line of this email, please put the position(s) you are interested in applying for.
** If you do have previous work experience in the cannabis industry, please make sure to provide a detailed work history somewhere within either your email or resume .** Including a link to any social media accounts (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter) is highly encouraged. If we feel that you are a good candidate, we will respond to your email with a location and time for interview. Again, ONLY candidates who have followed these directions will be considered.
Responsibilities and Duties
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
• Ensure stations are ready to go at venue opening time
• Maintain fully stocked and clean stations at all times
• Assist with running side work, stocking and cleaning during any and all downtime
• Ensure opening and closing cleaning and organization checklist is completed
• Coordinate and participate in periodic all staff cleanings and staff meetings
• Maintain proper cash handling procedure at all times
• Ensure all guests are greeted as they arrive and wished farewell upon their departure
• Ensure all guests/patients receive excellent customer service
• Inform the Inventory Manager or MOD if any product inventory is running low
• Be knowledgeable about everything and anything cannabis related
• Be knowledgeable of any and all specials including in house daily deals and Weedmaps daily deals
• Be active on social media sharing, liking, and posting all content shared on The Pottery's social media outlets
• Read industry publications to keep up-to-date on trends
• Ensure each guest receives your full attention during their transaction
• Keep all personal items off the sales floor at all times
• Ensure you are on time for each and every shift
• Ensure you have all tools at your station prepared for your shift
• Perform other duties or projects as assigned by any other Shift Lead, Manager or Superior
Qualifications and Skills
Requirements:
• Excellent Customer Service Skills
• Excellent Communication
• Precise Math Skills
• Organizational Skills
• Attention to Detail
• Multi-task Oriented
• Stress Management/Composure
• Ability to Stand for Long Periods
• Have a valid California Medical Recommendation and a valid California ID
• Must be 21 years or older
• Knowledge of marijuana strains, edibles, extracts and other current products on the market
Job Type: Full-time & Part Time
Salary: $12.00 to $14.00 /hour
Required experience:
• Customer Service: 2 years
• Retail Sales: 2 years
• Budtending: 1 year
Job Location:
• Los Angeles, CA
Required license or certification:
• MMJ doctor's recommendation or State MMJ card

This is the 3rd Cultivation course of 2018 since California's new medical and adult-use program has gone into effect. Expect a lot of new regulatory information and job opportunities with licensed businesses to exist. Our course is taught inside the future cultivation room of Green Trea, a collective located in the heart of LA's fashion and dispensary district. After completing the hands-on trimming demonstration, students will have the opportunity to tour the dispensary room, interface with friendly budtenders and purchase discounted products.

Join TRIM READY™ for our cannabis cultivation course. During this course, students will learn all aspects of cannabis cultivation, harvesting, trimming and manicuring. You will receive handouts on California's marijuana laws and discuss cultivation facility operating procedures. Upon course completion and certification, students will have a deeper understanding of the cannabis curing process and can start work.

When is the course?  Sunday April 8th, 2018, 4:00 pm to 7:00 pm
To Register:  https://www.eventbrite.com/e/los-angeles-cannabis-cultivation-harvesting-trimming-manicuring-course-tickets-43366840387

What does the Cannabis cultivation course cover?

-Proper use of security measures, procedures for responding to an emergency.
-Methods of cultivation and fertilization used by a facility.
-Standard operating procedures.
-Recognizing signs of insect infestation, pathogens and disease in marijuana plants.
-Safe disposal of plants.
-Nutritional requirements of plants at various growth stages, including proper mixing, dispersal of fertilizer and flushing procedures.
-Harvesting, drying and curing marijuana plants.
-Safe handling of equipment including lamps, electrical ballasts, pumps, fans and cutting equipment.

BONUS: HANDS-ON TRIMMING DEMONSTRATION


FAQs

Do I get a certificate?

Yes, all Trim Ready certification courses come with a certificate. You also will be added to our list of graduates and will receive emails regarding job placement. We do recommend that graduates update their resume and cover letter to include their most recent certification under the education/skills section.

Does my certification work in other states

Yes, TRIM READY™ certifications are accepted as professional achievements/technical training in most marijuana legal states and states we do business in (Nevada, California, Hawaii and Florida). After graduation, please follow the proper steps of updating your resume and cover letter so we can be reached in case your employer is requesting a verification or vocational reference.

Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?

There is no age requirement to attend the course, although the state you choose to work in might have age restrictions on working in a licensed cannabis facility.

Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?

Please email or call us.

Is my registration/ticket transferrable?

Your ticket can be transferred to another date.

Can I update my registration information?

Yes, either through the eventbrite website or by contacting Trim Ready.

Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?

Yes, for verification purposes.

What is the refund policy?

There is no refund, but you can transfer your ticket to a future date.
